metadata.title: Upgrading to CDKTF Version 0.6
metadata.description: Version 0.6 uses constructs version 10. Understand the API changes and learn how to migrate your projects.

outlineItems.title: Upgrading to CDK for Terraform Version 0.6
Upgrading a TypeScript / JavaScript CDKTF project

pageHeading.title: Upgrading to CDK for Terraform Version 0.6

const layoutProps={};const MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components,...props}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...props,components:components,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`CDK for Terraform version 0.6 uses `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://github.com/aws/constructs"},mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`constructs`)),` version 10. If you are using more advanced APIs from the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`constructs`),` library, refer to the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"#constructs-api-changes"},`Constructs API Changes`),` section.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"background"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#background","aria-label":"background permalink"},`\xbb`),`Background`),mdx("p",null,`Since version 0.6 the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf`),` package depends on `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`constructs`),` v10 (formerly was v3). While that jump might look big, v10 is actually going to be the next major version after v3. We made this change because the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`constructs`),` lib v10 is supposed to stay around for a while and is supposed to offer a very stable API.`),mdx("p",null,`To achieve this stability in the core functionality a lot has been removed from v10. For further background information you can read into the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://github.com/aws/constructs/pull/263"},`PR for v10`),` or the AWS CDK RFC `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://github.com/aws/aws-cdk-rfcs/blob/master/text/0192-remove-constructs-compat.md"},`Removal of Construct Compatibility Layer`),`.`),mdx("p",null,`While using the v0.6 `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf-cli`),` to deploy stacks that are using an older version of `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf`),` and `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`constructs`),` should still work, we recommend upgrading the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf`),` and `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`constructs`),` packages.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"pre-built-providers"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#pre-built-providers","aria-label":"pre built providers permalink"},`\xbb`),`Pre-built providers`),mdx("p",null,`All upcoming releases of the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://cdk.tf/prebuilt-providers"},`pre-built providers`),` will depend on `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`constructs`),` v10. So we recommend to upgrade your project.
If you cannot upgrade the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf`),` version, you can switch to `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/cdktf/concepts/providers#import-providers"},`generating provider bindings`),` via `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf get`),`.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"upgrading-a-typescript-javascript-cdktf-project"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#upgrading-a-typescript-javascript-cdktf-project","aria-label":"upgrading a typescript javascript cdktf project permalink"},`\xbb`),`Upgrading a TypeScript / JavaScript CDKTF project`),mdx("p",null,`To upgrade a TypeScript or JavaScript CDKTF project, adjust the versions in the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`package.json`),` file of your project.`),mdx("pre",{"className":"language-jsonc"},mdx("code",{parentName:"pre","className":"language-jsonc"},`{`,`
